intro: Canariopsis denticulata, commonly known as the toothed canaryweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped with serrated edges, giving it a distinctive appearance. Canariopsis denticulata is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and riverbanks.
